001package squidpony.squidmath;
002
003/**
004 * A parameterized IDistribution that can be configured to take various shapes.
005 * See <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kumaraswamy_distribution">Wikipedia's
006 * article on this distribution</a> for more.
007 */
008public class KumaraswamyDistribution extends IDistribution.SimpleDistribution implements IDistribution {
009    public static final KumaraswamyDistribution instance = new KumaraswamyDistribution(2.0, 2.0);
010
011    /**
012     * Shape parameter a.
013     * Stored internally as its reciprocal to avoid dividing extra times in {@link #nextDouble(IRNG)}.
014     */
015    private double a;
016    /**
017     * Shape parameter b.
018     * Stored internally as its reciprocal to avoid dividing extra times in {@link #nextDouble(IRNG)}.
019     */
020    private double b;
021    public double getA() {return 1.0/a;}
022    public void setA(double a) {this.a = 1.0/a;}
023    public double getB() {return 1.0/b;}
024    public void setB(double b) {this.b = 1.0/b;}
025
026    public KumaraswamyDistribution() {
027        this(2.0, 2.0);
028    }
029    public KumaraswamyDistribution(double a, double b) {
030        this.a = 1.0/a;
031        this.b = 1.0/b;
032    }
033
034    /**
035     * Gets a double between {@link #getLowerBound()} and {@link #getUpperBound()} that obeys this distribution.
036     *
037     * @param rng an IRNG, such as {@link RNG} or {@link GWTRNG}, that this will get one or more random numbers from
038     * @return a double within the range of {@link #getLowerBound()} and {@link #getUpperBound()}
039     */
040    @Override
041    public double nextDouble(IRNG rng) {
042        return Math.pow(1.0 - Math.pow(1.0 - rng.nextDouble(), b), a);
043    }
044}
